text.content:
Ancestries, Paths, Professions and Traditions, collectively called Character Options by the system, are journal entry pages that share similar concepts and function.

Such functions and concepts are usually not intuitive at first glance. For this reason, this documentation was made to help setting up character options correctly.

Benefits

Benefits are data blocks used by all Character Options, except Traditions.

All character options grant one or more benefits that might include:

  • Changes to Stats: Defense (Natural or Armored), Health, Size, Speed and Bonus Damage.

  • Common Traits & Knowledge: creature Type, Senses, Languages, Special Movement Traits, Immunities, Traditions.

  • Regular Items: Traits, Talents, Equipment and Spells.

Both Ancestries and Professions grant the benefits straight away when applied. Paths, on the other hand, grant benefits on certain Levels.

Item References

Items (Equipment, Traits, Talents, Spells etc) can be granted by some Character Option's benefits.

Since only actors (Characters, NPCs, etc) can carry items, Character Options only record item UUIDs (universal IDs) as references.

This means that items must first be created in a Compendium in order to be used in a Character Option.

To create a proper item reference for a character option, follow the instructions below.

Creating a New Item Reference

  1. Choose an Item Compendium: The first step is to create a new Item compendium or find one you already created and want to use for character options.

  2. Choose an Item: Select or create a new item from the Compendium chose in step 1.

  3. Drag and Drop the Item onto the Character Option: Drag the item from the Compendium and drop it onto one of the areas reserved for items in the Character Option's journal page. The areas will be highlighted to indicate where the item can be dropped.

  4. Done!

Editing an Item

Once an item reference is recorded in a Character Option, you can edit it by clicking on the edit button next to the item's name.

Remember that you'll be editing an item inside a compendium, so you might need to first unlock the compendium.

Removing an Item Reference

You can remove an item reference by clicking the trash bin button next to the item's name.

Remember that you are just removing the reference to the item, not the item itself. The item will stay in the compendium, untouched.

Using Character Options

After you are finished making a character option, you can drag it from the left sidebar in the Journal they are in and drop it onto an actor (Character, etc) sheet.

The actor will then have a link to the character option, and apply any changes it needs.
